info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 13 at 9:15AM MDT until October 14 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Grand Junction CO
info.description:
...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Colorado...
San Juan River at Pagosa Springs affecting Archuleta County.
For the San Juan River...including Bluff, Pagosa Springs...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...San Juan River at Pagosa Springs.
* WHEN...Until tomorrow evening.
* IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, water will approach the area around the River Center shopping complex in Pagosa Springs. Inundation of sections of Hermosa Street and low land areas adjacent to the river can be expected. At 12.4 feet, portions of the San Juan River Campground east of Pagosa Springs are beginning to flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM MDT Monday the stage was 7.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 11.8 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gjt.
The next statement will be issued this evening. Tuesday afternoon at 1215 PM MDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING
